content: कुबे(वे)रः [कुत्सितं बे(वे)रं शरीरं यस्य सः] The god of riches and treasure and the regent of the northern quarter; कुबेरगुप्तां दिशमुष्णरश्मौ गंतुं प्रवृत्ते समयं विलंघ्य <ls>Ku. 3. 25</ls> ({%vide%} <ls>Malli.</ls> thereon.). [Kubera is the son of Viśravas by Iḍaviḍā and thus the halfbrother of Rāvaṇa. Besides being the lord of riches and regent of the north, he is the king of the Yakṣas and Kinnaras, and a friend of Rudra. His abode is Kailāsa. He is represented as being deformed in body-having three legs, only eight teeth, and a yellow mark in place of one eye].
